body:
First Trust Advisors LP raised its position in shares of Netflix, Inc. (NASDAQ:NFLX) by 6.4% during the third quarter, according to its most recent filing with the SEC. The institutional investor owned 1,958,697 shares of the Internet television network’s stock after buying an additional 117,557 shares during the period. Netflix comprises about 0.6% of First Trust Advisors LP’s portfolio, making the stock its 15th largest position. First Trust Advisors LP owned about 0.46% of Netflix worth $193,030,000 as of its most recent filing with the SEC.

A number of other hedge funds have also bought and sold shares of the stock. Nisa Investment Advisors LLC boosted its stake in Netflix by 1.4% in the second quarter. Nisa Investment Advisors LLC now owns 141,490 shares of the Internet television network’s stock worth $12,944,000 after buying an additional 1,930 shares during the last quarter. Oakbrook Investments LLC boosted its stake in Netflix by 19.0% in the second quarter. Oakbrook Investments LLC now owns 38,760 shares of the Internet television network’s stock worth $3,546,000 after buying an additional 6,200 shares during the last quarter. Cornerstone Advisors Inc. boosted its stake in Netflix by 25.6% in the second quarter. Cornerstone Advisors Inc. now owns 1,118 shares of the Internet television network’s stock worth $102,000 after buying an additional 228 shares during the last quarter. HL Financial Services LLC boosted its stake in Netflix by 27.9% in the second quarter. HL Financial Services LLC now owns 2,813 shares of the Internet television network’s stock worth $257,000 after buying an additional 613 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Conning Inc. boosted its stake in Netflix by 0.3% in the second quarter. Conning Inc. now owns 10,915 shares of the Internet television network’s stock worth $999,000 after buying an additional 30 shares during the last quarter. 80.55% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors and hedge funds.

Shares of Netflix, Inc. (NASDAQ:NFLX) opened at 139.52 on Thursday. The company’s 50-day moving average is $128.53 and its 200 day moving average is $110.14. Netflix, Inc. has a 52-week low of $79.95 and a 52-week high of $143.46. The firm has a market capitalization of $59.96 billion, a P/E ratio of 324.47 and a beta of 1.67.

Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) last released its quarterly earnings data on Wednesday, January 18th. The Internet television network reported $0.15 EPS for the quarter, beating the Thomson Reuters’ consensus estimate of $0.13 by $0.02. The business had revenue of $2.48 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $2.47 billion. Netflix had a net margin of 2.11% and a return on equity of 7.51%. The company’s revenue was up 35.9% compared to the same quarter last year. During the same period in the prior year, the firm earned $0.10 earnings per share. Analysts expect that Netflix, Inc. will post $1.11 EPS for the current fiscal year.

NFLX has been the topic of a number of analyst reports. Wedbush reissued an “underperform” rating and issued a $45.00 target price on shares of Netflix in a research note on Friday, September 30th. Vetr cut shares of Netflix from a “buy” rating to a “hold” rating and set a $105.94 price objective on the stock. in a research note on Monday, October 3rd. Zacks Investment Research cut shares of Netflix from a “buy” rating to a “hold” rating in a research note on Tuesday, October 4th. Robert W. Baird reaffirmed a “neutral” rating and set a $94.00 price objective on shares of Netflix in a research note on Tuesday, October 4th. Finally, Loop Capital initiated coverage on shares of Netflix in a research note on Tuesday, October 4th. They set a “buy” rating and a $125.00 price objective on the stock. Five analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, fifteen have given a hold rating and twenty-eight have issued a buy rating to the stock. The company presently has a consensus rating of “Hold” and a consensus price target of $129.82.

In other news, CFO David B. Wells sold 500 shares of the stock in a transaction dated Wednesday, November 2nd. The shares were sold at an average price of $122.83, for a total value of $61,415.00. Following the sale, the chief financial officer now directly owns 500 shares of the company’s stock, valued at $61,415. The sale was disclosed in a legal filing with the SEC, which is available at this link. Also, Director Timothy M. Haley sold 23,728 shares of the stock in a transaction dated Monday, October 31st. The stock was sold at an average price of $126.14, for a total transaction of $2,993,049.92. Following the completion of the sale, the director now directly owns 9,576 shares in the company, valued at $1,207,916.64. The disclosure for this sale can be found here. Over the last three months, insiders sold 307,891 shares of company stock worth $39,000,572. Insiders own 4.90% of the company’s stock.

Netflix Inc is an Internet television network with over 86 million members in over 190 countries enjoying more than 125 million hours of television (TV) shows and movies per day, including original series, documentaries and feature films. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on nearly any Internet-connected screen.

title: First Trust Advisors LP Has $193,030,000 Position in Netflix, Inc. (NFLX)
